text: Gilbert "Gil" Scott-Heron (April 1, 1949 â€“ May 27, 2011) was an American poet, musician, and author. He is best known for his work in spoken-word soul music in the 1960s and 1970s and his work with Brian Jackson. Scott-Heron is most famous for his poem and song, The Revolution Will Not Be Televised. This piece helped develop the black protest movement and influenced the rap genre. In 2010, he released an album titled I'm New Here. Scott-Heron became HIV- positive. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== Category:African-American musicians Category:African-American writers Category:American blues musicians Category:American jazz musicians Category:American poets Category:American soul musicians Category:Musicians from Chicago Category:People with HIV/AIDS Category:Singers from Chicago Category:Writers from Chicago Category:1949 births Category:2011 deaths
title: Gil Scott-Heron
